Indeed, in His saying, the Most High: "Then lead them to the path of Hell. And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned." The people, after these terrors, are driven to the Path [al-Sirat], which is a bridge stretched over the back of the Fire, sharper than the sword and finer than a hair. Whoever was upright [istaqama] in this world on the Straight Path [al-Sirat al-Mustaqim] will find the Path of the Hereafter light and will be saved. And whoever deviated from uprightness [istiqama] in the world [dunya] and burdened his back with sins [awzar] and disobeyed will stumble at the first step on the Path and will fall. So reflect now on what terror would settle in your heart [fu'ad] if you saw the Path and its fineness, then your sight fell upon the blackness of Hell beneath it, then your hearing was struck by the roaring of the Fire and its rage, and you were charged to walk on the Path despite the weakness of your state, the agitation of your heart [qalb], the trembling of your foot, and the heaviness of your back with sins [awzar] that prevent you from walking on the carpet of the earth, let alone the sharpness of the Path. How then will you be when you place one of your feet upon it and feel its sharpness, and you are compelled to lift the second foot, while the creatures before you are slipping and stumbling, and the guardians of Hell pull them down with hooks and grappling irons, and you look at them as they are turned upside down, their heads descending towards the Fire and their feet raised? Oh, what a sight, how dreadful it is! And what a difficult ascent! And what a narrow passage! So look at your state as you crawl upon it and climb it, while you are burdened with your sins [awzar], turning right and left to the creatures as they plummet into the Fire, and the Messenger, peace be upon him, is saying: "O Lord, grant safety, grant safety!" And the cries of "Woe!" and "Ruin!" have risen to you from the depths of Hell due to the multitude of creatures who slipped from the Path. How then will you be if your foot slips and your regret does not benefit you, and you cry out "Woe!" and "Ruin!" and say, "This is what I used to fear! Oh, would that I had sent ahead for my life! Oh, would that I had taken with the Messenger a way! Oh, woe to me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so as a friend! Oh, would that I were dust! Oh, would that I were forgotten, utterly forgotten! Oh, would that my mother had not borne me!" And at that, the fires snatch youâ€”we seek refuge in Godâ€”and the caller calls out: "Be driven into it, and do not speak to Me!" Then no way remains except screaming, groaning, panting, and calling for help. So how do you see your intellect now, with these dangers before you? If you are not a believer in that, how long your stay will be with the disbelievers in the depths of Hell! And if you are a believer in it, yet heedless of it and negligent in preparing for it, how great is your loss and your transgression! And what will benefit you?

a.g: And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."
[They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"
But they, that Day, are in surrender.
And they will approach one another blaming each other.
They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."
The oppressors will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,
And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.
So the word of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].
And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."
So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.
Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.
Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but Allah," were arrogant
And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
Rather, the Prophet has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.
Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,
And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -
But not the chosen servants of Allah.
Those will have a provision determined -
Fruits; and they will be honored
In gardens of pleasure
On thrones facing one another.
There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,
White and delicious to the drinkers;
No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.
And with them will be women limiting [their] glances, with large, [beautiful] eyes,

Indeed, in His saying, the Most High: "And Allah created you and what you do" [37:96]. **The First Foundation:** The knowledge [ma'rifa] that every originated thing in the world [al-'alam] is His act [fi'l], His creation [khalq], and His invention [ikhtira'], with no creator [khalq] for it other than Him and no originator [muhdith] for it except Him. He created the creation [al-khalq] and fashioned them, and He brought into existence their power [qudra] and their movement [haraka]. Thus, all the actions [af'al] of His servants are created [makhluqa] by Him and connected to His power [qudra], in confirmation of Him in His saying, the Most High: "Allah is the Creator [Khaliq] of all things" [39:62], and in His saying, the Most High: "And Allah created you and what you do" [37:96], and in His saying, the Most High: "Whether you conceal your speech or proclaim it, indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts [sudur]" [67:13]. "Does He who created not know?" [67:14] And He is the Subtle, the Acquainted. He commanded the servants to be cautious in their statements, their actions [af'al], their secrets [asrar], and their hidden thoughts, due to His knowledge ['ilm] of the sources of their actions [af'al]. And He argued for the knowledge ['ilm] through the creation [khalq]. And how could He not be the Creator [Khaliq] of the servant's action [fi'l], when His power [qudra] is perfect, with no deficiency in it, and it is connected to the movement [haraka] of the servants' bodies? And the movements [harakat] are alike, and the connection of the power [qudra] to them is for their own essence. So what is it that restricts its connection from some movements [harakat] and not others, given their similarity? Or how could the animal be independent in invention [ikhtira'], when from the spider, the bee, and all other animals issue subtle crafts [sana'at] that confound the intellects [uqul] of those of understanding [al-albab]?
